Comment: You don't let it get to you. Let it slide away. Pick your battles. Keep paying attention, but do your best not to let the small stuff bother you.  For example, the recent controversy about Whitmer talking at a Trump "rally." I scanned a couple articles: It was an announcement that a major military base in MI wasn't gong to close. Her words amounted to how important the base was and a thanks for the announcement. Now, let it go. It doesn't matter and isn't worth getting worked up about. Even if you disagree with her being there, she's a sitting governor and must interact with the President sometimes.  If something seems like it was purpose built to piss people off, then it probably was, and should be treated accordingly. It's much more important to save your energy for the big things. Things like US citizens getting deported now. Things like ignoring judicial rulings. Pick your battles, and those are big battles with big consequences.
Author: InsuranceToTheRescue

Just make sure to vote and if you "want" to do something, then you decide what that something is. But, don't make yourself sick because that will do nobody any good:)
